title.narrative: State Owned Financial Institutions Strengthening Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the State-Owned Financial Institutions Strengthening Project for Serbia is to improve the performance of Banka Postanska Stedionica AD Beograd and promote the reform of development finance institutions and other state-owned financial institutions. The project comprises of two components. The first component is support the reform of state owned financial institutions. The second component, strengthen institutional capacity will finance technical assistance (TA) and investments in critical areas that are needed to support the achievement of the disbursement linked indicators (DLIs) and disbursement linked results (DLRs).

title.narrative: Number of outreach sessions organized with business representatives as a two-way interaction
BPS BoD adopts (i) strengthened risk management policies and the Executive Board adopts implementing procedures, and (ii) compensation scheme in line with approved 2018-2020 business plan
BPS completes installation of core banking system and associated software, hardware and services
Strategy for Development Finance has been adopted
Tender issued for the sale of SOFIs' NPLs, in an approximate amount of EUR 145.6 million
Updated NPL resolution strategy, which includes a strategy for state-owned NPLs with a separate action plan, has been adopted
BPS in compliance with limit on lending to State Owned Enterprises
BPS is in compliance with the prudential ratios set forth in Selected NBS Decisions
BPS gross NPLs are reduced compared to end-2016
Reduction in state-owned NPLs compared to end-2016
BPS gross amount of performing credit exposures to medium and large private sector enterprises is reduced compared to end-2016
